data.text: @maryturner_ Well here's hoping it's not :( I was looking into getting a blood test that detects if you have the antibodies and got covid but if you've been vaccinated it doesn't work or count after that fact
@cathartic_dream I mean no test is 100%. And we knew when we rolled out the at home ones that they would be less precise but more accessible than PCRs. So here we are.

@maryturner_ Yeah I get it. I went through it in December. Had every symptom of omi and 3 rapids were negative. My PCR was a month later and negative but I also know too many people that took 4 or 5 pcrs and was positive on the 6th. That's why I truly believe it when they say cases are 20k rn
@cathartic_dream Like this is just a lose-lose situation if I actually do have COVID. People can’t be expected to use the tests differently than what they’re instructed to do IMO.

@cathartic_dream Yeah the thing is at this point we should really be using these tests according to their instructions. And if after two tests they’re still negative? It’s all I can do since we don’t have access to PCR tests here.
@maryturner_ I've heard such issues with these even determining covid. Also heard others that swabbed in the mouth too and got positive results that way vs nose
